title: Trimbakeshwar Jyotirlinga Temple
subtitle: One of the twelve sacred Jyotirlingas dedicated to Lord Shiva
overview: Trimbakeshwar Temple, located near Nashik, is one of the holiest shrines dedicated to Lord Shiva and one of the twelve Jyotirlingas in India.

Nestled at the foothills of the Brahmagiri range, the temple is also the origin of the sacred Godavari River, known as the Ganga of the South. The temple’s unique Shiva Lingam represents Lord Brahma, Vishnu, and Mahesh — symbolizing the trinity of divine forces.

highlights.title: Sacred Jyotirlinga
highlights.description: Houses one of the twelve Jyotirlingas in India — the Trimbakeshwar form of Lord Shiva.

highlights.title: Origin of River Godavari
highlights.description: The holy Godavari River originates here, enhancing the temple’s spiritual importance.

geography.intro: Situated at the base of Brahmagiri Hills, Trimbakeshwar is surrounded by lush green forests and scenic mountain terrain.

climate.description: Trimbakeshwar experiences pleasant weather throughout the year, ideal for temple visits and pilgrimages.

seasons.text: Best time to visit: October to March

geography.conclusion: The spiritual and natural aura of Trimbakeshwar makes it a must-visit for seekers of divine energy and peace.

activities.title: Temple Darshan & Abhishek
activities.description: Participate in the morning and evening Aartis, and perform Rudrabhishek for spiritual blessings.
info: Devotees can book Abhishek rituals through the official temple trust.
Special pujas are conducted during Shravan and Maha Shivratri.

activities.title: Kusavarta Kund
activities.description: A sacred pond considered the symbolic origin of the Godavari River.
info: Devotees take a holy dip here before temple darshan.
Rituals like Pitru Tarpan and Narayan Nagbali are performed nearby.

activities.title: Brahmagiri Hill Trek
activities.description: A scenic and spiritual trek to the source of the Godavari River atop Brahmagiri Hills.
info: Trek offers panoramic views and numerous small shrines along the way.
Carry water and comfortable shoes; moderate difficulty level.

attractions.title: Godavari Source Point
attractions.description: The sacred point where the Godavari River emerges from the Brahmagiri Hills.

attractions.title: Panchavati (Nashik)
attractions.description: A major pilgrimage area on the banks of Godavari with temples like Kalaram Mandir.

marineLife.intro: Though not coastal, the divine flow of the Godavari River gives Trimbakeshwar a sacred aquatic significance.

items.title: Godavari River
items.description: Regarded as a purifying and life-giving force in Hindu mythology.

items.title: Holy Rituals
items.description: Several important Hindu ceremonies are performed on the riverbanks.

conclusion: The sacred connection between water and divinity is evident throughout Trimbakeshwar.
The temple’s tranquil setting enhances its spiritual energy.

howToReach.title: By Road
details: Regular bus and taxi services connect Nashik to Trimbakeshwar.

howToReach.title: By Rail
details: Nearest railway station: Nashik Road (39 km).
Frequent trains from Mumbai, Pune, and Aurangabad.

bookingTips.description: Visit during Maha Shivratri or Shravan month for major celebrations.
Temple opens from 5:30 AM to 9:00 PM; early morning is ideal for darshan.
Carry water and footwear for the Brahmagiri Hill trek.
